VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Work-Life Balance relative to the peak of Career Growth in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Work-Life Balance is to the {right} of the peak of Career Growth.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Job Security show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Job Security shows a {Periodic fluctuation}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Work-Life Balance reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Career Growth} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =81.5?
EVJ.A: At X =81.5,the label with the highest density is {Work-Life Balance}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 30? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Remote Work Options}'s peak at {34},{Company Culture}'s peak at {82},{Career Growth}'s peak at {56},{Job Security}'s peak at {85},{Work-Life Balance}'s peak at {83},{Workplace Benefits}'s peak at {81}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 38? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Work-Life Balance or Job Security?
NC.A: {Job Security} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Workplace Benefits or Remote Work Options?
NC.A: {Workplace Benefits} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {5} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Career Growth}
